nodes.documentation: @notice ensures that the market for language exchange actually exists
nodes.name: creation

nodes.documentation: @notice ensures that only the market owner can do this
nodes.name: onlyOwner

nodes.documentation: @notice circuitBreaker to see if the function is paused
nodes.name: checkIfPaused

nodes.documentation:
@notice used to prevent integer overflow where users can infput
 @dev notice the number. It's the current exchange rate of 100 dollars an hour
nodes.name: stopIntOverflow

nodes.documentation: @notice ensures that the market for students and teachers can only be created one time
nodes.name: onlyOnce

nodes.documentation: @notice ensures that whatever function is called is called 60 seconds after it is scheduled
nodes.name: allowed

nodes.documentation:
@notice constructor that sets the market information
 @dev assigns a market owner who has the ability to flip the circuit breaker

@notice  flips a state var that pauses all value transfer functions
 @dev used as a defense against malicious users for in the instance that the contract is compromised
nodes.name: circuitPauseAllFundMovement

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "You have to deposit at least an hours worth of stake."

arguments.value: You have to deposit at least an hours worth of stake.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "You have to deposit at least an hours worth of stake."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "There is already a tutor at this address."

arguments.value: There is already a tutor at this address.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "There is already a tutor at this address."

nodes.documentation:
@notice creates a tutor with a series of attributes
 @dev the unit conversions for setRate are in wei by default
nodes.name: createTutor

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "There is already a student at this address."

arguments.value: There is already a student at this address.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "There is already a student at this address."

nodes.documentation:
@notice creates a language learner with a series of attributes
 @dev notice the bool value line 135 - this is used for reference when scheduling lesson
nodes.name: createStudent

nodes.documentation:
@notice funds a student account given that the account exists
 @dev default storage value is in wei. Users can deposit any value conversion they wish
nodes.name: fundStudentAccount

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) returns (function (bytes memory) payable returns (bool,bytes memory))

arguments.value: Transfer failed.

nodes.documentation:
@notice allows the students to withdraw their funds 
 @dev withdrawl amount is, by default, wei
nodes.name: studentWithdrawTotalFunds

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) returns (function (bytes memory) payable returns (bool,bytes memory))

arguments.value: Transfer failed.

nodes.documentation:
@notice allows the tutor to withdraw their funds    
 @dev all amounts are, by defaul, wei
nodes.name: tutorWithdrawFunds

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "It seems that either you don't have an account, you ACTUALLY ARE THE TUTOR - SAVEY?, or your tutor doesn't have the required stake amount."

arguments.value: It seems that either you don't have an account, you ACTUALLY ARE THE TUTOR - SAVEY?, or your tutor doesn't have the required stake amount.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "It seems that either you don't have an account, you ACTUALLY ARE THE TUTOR - SAVEY?, or your tutor doesn't have the required stake amount."

nodes.documentation:
@notice this function schedules a lesson and then it also trustakes fundstr
 @dev notice the the keccak function to create a unique lesson ID. This can be improved.
nodes.name: scheduleLesson

nodes.documentation: @notice this function takes the students funds out of their account, as well as the tutors, as a promise that it'll happen
nodes.name: stakeFunds

arguments.value: You are not the tutor.

nodes.documentation:
@notice this function allows tutors to confirm the lesson 
 @dev this, and the tutor conifirmation, are the two functions used to enable transferFunds()
nodes.name: tutorConfirmLesson

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "You are not the student of this lesson."

arguments.value: You are not the student of this lesson.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "You are not the student of this lesson."

nodes.documentation: @notice this function allows students to confirm the lesson
nodes.name: studentConfirmLesson

nodes.documentation: @notice confirms that the lesson has been confirmed prior to transfer
nodes.name: lessonConfirmed

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Either the lesson has not been confirmed or you're trying to steal money."

arguments.value: Either the lesson has not been confirmed or you're trying to steal money.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Either the lesson has not been confirmed or you're trying to steal money."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "It looks like you're neither the student or teacher."

arguments.value: It looks like you're neither the student or teacher.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "It looks like you're neither the student or teacher."

nodes.documentation:
@notice tranfers funds between students and tutors after the lesson
 @return returns bool to confirm that the transfer has occurred
nodes.name: transferFunds

nodes.documentation:
@notice see the info about the lesson
 @return the addresses of all of the lessons in total
nodes.name: getLessonInfo

nodes.documentation:
@notice allows us to pull the teacher's information from the blockchain
 @return returns the tutor's total funds and hourly rate
nodes.name: getTutorInfo

nodes.documentation:
@notice allows us to pull the students info from the blockchain
 @return the student's address and total funds
nodes.name: getStudentInfo

nodes.documentation:
@notice see the adddresses of all the tutors
 @return a list of the tutor's total adddresses
nodes.name: getAllTutors

nodes.documentation:
@notice see the address of all the students
 @return a list of the all the tutor addresses
nodes.name: getAllStudents

nodes.documentation: @notice gets all the lessons
nodes.name: getAllLessons

nodes.documentation:
@notice see info of the user that ownes the market
 @return the market exists bool, who the owner is, what address, and how many times it has been counted
nodes.name: getMktOwner

nodes.documentation:
@notice tells us the status of the circuit breaker
 @return the bool that tells us if the contract is paused
nodes.name: getCircuitBreakerInfo

devdoc.author: Huckleberry J. Hopper
devdoc.details: All functions calls are handled within this one contract and this is not production ready

circuitPauseAllFundMovement().details: used as a defense against malicious users for in the instance that the contract is compromised

constructor.details: assigns a market owner who has the ability to flip the circuit breaker

createStudent().details: notice the bool value line 135 - this is used for reference when scheduling lesson

createTutor(uint256).details: the unit conversions for setRate are in wei by default

fundStudentAccount().details: default storage value is in wei. Users can deposit any value conversion they wish

getAllStudents().return: a list of the all the tutor addresses

getAllTutors().return: a list of the tutor's total adddresses

getCircuitBreakerInfo().return: the bool that tells us if the contract is paused

getLessonInfo(bytes32).return: the addresses of all of the lessons in total

getMktOwner().return: the market exists bool, who the owner is, what address, and how many times it has been counted

getStudentInfo(address).return: the student's address and total funds

getTutorInfo(address).return: returns the tutor's total funds and hourly rate

scheduleLesson(address).details: notice the the keccak function to create a unique lesson ID. This can be improved.

studentWithdrawTotalFunds(uint256).details: withdrawl amount is, by default, wei

transferFunds(bytes32).return: returns bool to confirm that the transfer has occurred

tutorConfirmLesson(bytes32).details: this, and the tutor conifirmation, are the two functions used to enable transferFunds()

tutorWithdrawFunds(uint256).details: all amounts are, by defaul, wei

devdoc.title: A decentralized language exchange application

circuitPauseAllFundMovement().notice: flips a state var that pauses all value transfer functions

methods.constructor: constructor that sets the market information

createStudent().notice: creates a language learner with a series of attributes

createTutor(uint256).notice: creates a tutor with a series of attributes

fundStudentAccount().notice: funds a student account given that the account exists

getAllStudents().notice: see the address of all the students

getAllTutors().notice: see the adddresses of all the tutors

getCircuitBreakerInfo().notice: tells us the status of the circuit breaker

getLessonInfo(bytes32).notice: see the info about the lesson

getMktOwner().notice: see info of the user that ownes the market

getStudentInfo(address).notice: allows us to pull the students info from the blockchain

getTutorInfo(address).notice: allows us to pull the teacher's information from the blockchain

scheduleLesson(address).notice: this function schedules a lesson and then it also trustakes fundstr

studentConfirmLesson(bytes32).notice: this function allows students to confirm the lesson

studentWithdrawTotalFunds(uint256).notice: allows the students to withdraw their funds

transferFunds(bytes32).notice: tranfers funds between students and tutors after the lesson

tutorConfirmLesson(bytes32).notice: this function allows tutors to confirm the lesson

tutorWithdrawFunds(uint256).notice: allows the tutor to withdraw their funds

userdoc.notice: Creates and handles tutor and student accounts/funds, stakes funds, and confirms lesson logic for fund transfer
